DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Feces Lipid Outcome Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of feces, material discharged from the bowel during defecation for lipids or fatty acid esters, oily organic compounds insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of feces, material discharged from the bowel during defecation for lipids or fatty acid esters, oily organic compounds insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.:Lipids are fatty acid esters, an oily organic compound insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

A class of hydrocarbon-containing organic compounds. Lipids are insoluble in water but soluble in nonpolar solvents and play important roles in living organisms: these roles include functioning as energy storage molecules, serving as structural components of cell membranes, and constituting important signaling molecules. Lipids can be subdivided into 2 groups: fatty acids and glycerides.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
